channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress has been dumped, 12th August
item.description:
A mattress has been dumped by the railings in the corner of our carpark in Montana Gardens. Please can it be removed as it will encourage more fly tipping?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montana Gardens, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large & dangerous cracks on Cycle Track, 12th August
item.description:
From Tent Peg Lane car park, take the Cycle Track which runs parallel to the footpath. Just before the bridge over the ditch, several large cracks have opened up. One is approx. 5cm wide. These are really dangerous for cyclists as their wheels could get caught in them resulting in an accident. These cracks are largely where previous repairs have been made but now have opened up again. Urgent attention needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tent Peg Lane, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree growing through tarmac and sending out runners, 12th August
item.description:
Outside 42A Durham Avenue a damaged tree was cut down and then the area was tarmacked over by the council. The tree has now regrown through the tarmac and is sending out runners under the block paved drop kerb (for which we contributed to the extra cost). There are also runners appearing in our garden. The photographs show the tree regrowing, the block paving beginning to lift and one of the runners we have removed from our garden. The runners are coming under our garden wall and will begin to undermine that as well as the paving.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Durham Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row
